caption.title: Number of days below 9°C by latitude at different locations along the east coast of the US from 2012–2016.
caption.p: Points in black indicate observational data from the CBL Pier and the National Data Buoy Center. The black line is the linear regression of the observations with latitude. The red and blue points indicate the location equivalent to number of days below 9°C projected by the extended trend and the multi-model ensemble of downscaled GCM data, respectively. Direct extension of trend in the observational data predicted a shortening of the overwintering period from 117±15 days to 90±1 days and the downscaled GCM model data predicted a shortening of the current overwintering period to 56±15 days.
